<p style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: left">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;"><b><i>Executive Overview</i></b></p>

<p style="font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 36pt;">We are a leading provider of megawatt-scale solutions that enhance the performance of the power grid, protect our Navy's fleet, and lower the cost of wind power. In the power grid market, we enable electric utilities, industrial facilities, and renewable energy project developers to connect, transmit and distribute power through our transmission planning services and power electronics and superconductor-based systems. In the wind power market, we enable manufacturers to field highly competitive wind turbines through our advanced power electronics and control system products, engineering, and support services. Our power grid and wind products and services provide exceptional reliability, security, efficiency and affordability to our customers.</p>

<p style="font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt 7.2pt;text-align:justify;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 36pt;">Our power system solutions help to improve energy efficiency, alleviate power grid capacity constraints, improve system resiliency, and increase the adoption of renewable energy generation. Demand for our solutions is driven by the growing needs for modernized smart grids that improve power reliability, security and quality, the U.S. Navy's effort to upgrade in-board power systems to support fleet electrification, and the need for increased renewable sources of electricity, such as wind and solar energy. Concerns about these factors have led to increased spending by corporations and the military, as well as supportive government regulations and initiatives on local, state, and national levels, including renewable portfolio standards, tax incentives and international treaties.</p>

<p style="font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:27.75pt;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 36pt;">We manufacture products using two proprietary core technologies: PowerModule&#8482; programmable power electronic converters and our Amperium&#174; high temperature superconductor (&#8220;HTS&#8221;) wires. These technologies and our system-level solutions are protected by a broad and deep intellectual property portfolio consisting of hundreds of patents and licenses worldwide.</p>

<p style="font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:27.75pt;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 36pt;">We operate our business under two market-facing business units: Grid and Wind. We believe this market-centric structure enables us to more effectively anticipate and meet the needs of electric utilities, power generation project developers and wind turbine manufacturers.</p>

<p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 36pt;">&nbsp;</p>

<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="width: 100%; text-indent: 0px; font-family: Times New Roman; font-size: 10pt;">

		<tr style="vertical-align: top; font-family: Times New Roman; font-size: 10pt;">
			<td style="width: 45pt; font-family: Times New Roman; font-size: 10pt;">&nbsp;</td>
			<td style="width: 22px; font-family: Times New Roman; font-size: 10pt;">
			<p style="font-family: Times New Roman; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: left;">&#8226;</p>
			</td>
			<td style="font-family: Times New Roman; font-size: 10pt; width: 1098px;">
			<p style="font-family: Times New Roman; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;"><i>Grid.&nbsp;</i>Through our Gridtec Solutions&#8482;, our Grid business segment enables electric utilities and renewable energy project developers to connect, transmit and distribute power with exceptional efficiency, reliability, security and affordability. We provide transmission planning services that allow us to identify power grid congestion, poor power quality, and other risks, which help us determine how our solutions can improve network performance. These services often lead to sales of our grid interconnection solutions for wind farms and solar power plants, power quality systems and transmission and distribution cable systems.&nbsp;&nbsp;We also sell ship protection products to the U.S. Navy through our Grid business segment.</p>
			</td>
		</tr>

</table>

<p style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0pt; margin: 2pt 0pt; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; background-color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0); color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">&nbsp;</p>

<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="width: 100%; text-indent: 0px; font-family: Times New Roman; font-size: 10pt;">

		<tr style="vertical-align: top; font-family: Times New Roman; font-size: 10pt;">
			<td style="width: 68px; font-family: Times New Roman; font-size: 10pt;">&nbsp;</td>
			<td style="width: 28px; font-family: Times New Roman; font-size: 10pt;">
			<p style="font-family: Times New Roman; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: left;">&#8226;</p>
			</td>
			<td style="font-family: Times New Roman; font-size: 10pt; width: 1276px;">
			<p style="font-family: Times New Roman; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;"><i>Wind.&nbsp;</i>Through our Windtec Solutions&#8482;, our Wind business segment enables manufacturers to field wind turbines with exceptional power output, reliability and affordability. We supply advanced power electronics and control systems, license our highly engineered wind turbine designs, and provide extensive customer support services to wind turbine manufacturers. Our design portfolio includes a broad range of drive trains and power ratings of 2 megawatts (&#8220;MW&#8221;) and higher. We provide a broad range of power electronics and software-based control systems that are highly integrated and designed for optimized performance, efficiency, and grid compatibility.</p>
			</td>
		</tr>

</table>

<p style="font-family: Times New Roman; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 36pt;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="font-family: Times New Roman; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 36pt;">Our fiscal year begins on April&nbsp;1 and ends on March&nbsp;31. When we refer to a particular fiscal year, we are referring to the fiscal year beginning on April&nbsp;1 of that same year. For example, fiscal 2019 refers to the fiscal year beginning on April&nbsp;1, 2019. Other fiscal years follow similarly.</p>

<p style="font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:27.75pt;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 36pt;">On July 3, 2018, we and our wholly-owned subsidiaries Suzhou AMSC Superconductor Co. Ltd. (&#8220;AMSC China&#8221;) and AMSC Austria GmbH (&#8220;AMSC Austria&#8221;) entered into a settlement agreement (the &#8220;Settlement Agreement&#8221;) with Sinovel Wind Group Co., Ltd. (&#8220;Sinovel&#8221;). The Settlement Agreement settles the litigation and arbitration proceedings between us and Sinovel listed on Schedule 2 of the Settlement Agreement (the &#8220;Proceedings&#8221;), and any other civil claims, counterclaims, causes of action, rights and obligations directly or indirectly relating to the subject matters of the Proceedings and the contracts between us and Sinovel listed on Schedules 1 and 4 of the Settlement Agreement, subject to the exception described in Section 1.1 of the Settlement Agreement. The Settlement Agreement was filed as Exhibit 10.1 to the Company&#8217;s Form 8-K filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission on July 9, 2018. Under the terms of the Settlement Agreement, Sinovel agreed to pay AMSC China an aggregate cash amount in Renminbi (&#8220;RMB&#8221;) equivalent to $57.5 million, consisting of two installments. Sinovel paid the first installment of the RMB equivalent of $32.5 million on July 4, 2018 and paid the second installment of the RMB equivalent of $25.0 million on December 27, 2018.</p>

<p style="font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:left;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 36pt;">In addition, pursuant to the terms of the Settlement Agreement, we and AMSC Austria have granted Sinovel a non-exclusive license for certain of our intellectual property to be used solely in Sinovel&#8217;s doubly fed wind turbines (the &#8220;License&#8221;). We have agreed not to sue Sinovel, Sinovel&#8217;s power converter suppliers or Sinovel&#8217;s customers for use of the technology covered by the License.</p>

<p style="font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:27.75pt;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 36pt;">On October 31, 2018, we entered into a Subcontract Agreement with Commonwealth Edison Company (&#8220;ComEd&#8221;) (the &#8220;Subcontract Agreement&#8221;) for the manufacture and installation of the Company&#8217;s REG system within ComEd&#8217;s electric grid in Chicago, Illinois (the &#8220;Project&#8221;). As provided in the Subcontract Agreement, the Subcontract Agreement became effective upon the signing of an amendment by us and the U.S. Department of Homeland Security (&#8220;DHS&#8221;) to the existing contract (the &#8220;Prime Contract&#8221;) between us and DHS on June 20, 2019. Unless terminated earlier by us, ComEd or DHS according to the terms of the Subcontract Agreement, the term of the Subcontract Agreement will continue until we complete our warranty obligations under the Subcontract Agreement. Under the terms of the Subcontract Agreement, we have agreed, among other things, to provide the REG system and to supervise ComEd&#8217;s installation of the REG system in Chicago. As part of our separate cost sharing arrangement with DHS under the Prime Contract, we expect funding provided by DHS in connection with the Subcontract Agreement to be between $9.0 to $11.0 million, which represents the total amount of revenue we are expected to recognize over the term of the Subcontract Agreement and includes up to $1.0 million that we have agreed to reimburse ComEd for costs incurred by ComEd while undertaking its tasks under the Subcontract Agreement (the &#8220;Reimbursement Amount&#8221;). In addition, we are required to deliver an irrevocable letter of credit in the amount of $5.0 million to secure certain Company obligations under the Subcontract Agreement. ComEd has agreed to provide the site and provide all civil engineering work required to support the installation, operation and integration of the REG system into ComEd&#8217;s electric grid. Other than the Reimbursement Amount, ComEd is responsible for its own costs and expenses. DHS&#8217;s approval to commence with construction was obtained on June 20, 2019. Substation work on the project began in late 2019.&nbsp; The REG system is expected to be operational in 2021.</p>

<p style="font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:27pt;">&nbsp;</p>

<div class="PGBK" style="width: 100%; margin-left: 0pt; margin-right: 0pt">
<div class="PGNUM" style="text-align: center; width: 100%; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt;">24</div>

<hr style="page-break-after: always; border: none; width: 100%; height: 2px; color: #000000; background-color: #000000">
<div class="PGHDR" style="text-align: left; width: 100%">&nbsp;</div>
</div>

<p style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: left">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:left;"><b><i>Critical Accounting Policies and Estimates</i></b></p>

<p style="font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:left;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 36pt;">The preparation of the unaudited condensed consolidated financial statements requires that we make estimates and judgments that affect the reported amounts of assets, liabilities, revenues and expenses, and related disclosure of contingent assets and liabilities. We base our estimates on historical experience and various other assumptions that are believed to be reasonable under the circumstances, the results of which form the basis for making judgments about the carrying values of assets and liabilities that are not readily apparent from other sources. Actual results may differ under different assumptions or conditions. Effective April 1, 2019, we adopted ASU 2016-02, which provides for new requirements in regards to leases. See Note 14, "Leases" for further details. Aside from the adoption of ASU 2016-02, there were no significant changes in the critical accounting policies that were disclosed in our Form 10-K for fiscal 2018, which ended on March&nbsp;31, 2019.</p>

<p style="font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;"><b><i>Results of Operations</i></b></p>

<p style="font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="margin: 0pt; text-align: justify; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,Times,serif; font-size: 10pt;"><b><i>Three and&nbsp;<a data-tblloc="11x0" data-tblname="11849" data-tblv="27" id="led11849F20198231569259850489">nine months ended December 31, 2019</a> compared to the&nbsp;<a data-tblloc="27x1" data-tblname="11848" data-tblv="27" id="led11848F20198221569196012709">three and nine</a> months ended&nbsp;<a data-tblloc="22x1" data-tblname="11848" data-tblv="27" id="led11848F20195281561732743553">December 31, 2018</a> </i></b></p>

<p style="font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:left;"><b><i>Revenues</i></b></p>

<p style="font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:left;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 36pt;">Total revenues increased&nbsp;<a data-tblloc="1x1" data-tblname="27479" data-tblv="27" id="led27479F20200191579477502920">27%</a>&nbsp;and <a data-tblloc="1x2" data-tblname="27479" data-tblv="27" id="led27479F20200191579477550465">10%</a>&nbsp;to $<a data-tblloc="2x1" data-tblname="12412" data-tblv="27" id="led12412F20195281561733115450">17.9</a> million and $<a data-tblloc="2x2" data-tblname="12412" data-tblv="27" id="led12412F20198221569196323579">45.7</a> million for the&nbsp;<a data-tblloc="27x1" data-tblname="11848" data-tblv="27" id="led11848F20198221569196012709">three and nine</a> months ended&nbsp;<a data-tblloc="21x1" data-tblname="11848" data-tblv="27" id="led11848F20195281561733269219">December 31, 2019</a>, compared to $14.1 million and $41.6 million for the&nbsp;<a data-tblloc="27x1" data-tblname="11848" data-tblv="27" id="led11848F20198221569196012709">three and nine</a> months ended <a data-tblloc="22x1" data-tblname="11848" data-tblv="27" id="led11848F20195281561733292601">December 31, 2018</a>.&nbsp;&nbsp;Our revenues are summarized as follows (in thousands):</p>

<p style="font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:27.75pt;">&nbsp;</p>

</table>

<p style="font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:27.75pt;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 36pt;">Our Grid business unit accounted for&nbsp;<a data-tblloc="4x1" data-tblname="12412" data-tblv="27" id="led12412F20199161571238737884">85%</a> and&nbsp;<a data-tblloc="4x2" data-tblname="12412" data-tblv="27" id="led12412F20199161571238766369">80%</a> of total revenues for the&nbsp;<a data-tblloc="27x1" data-tblname="11848" data-tblv="27" id="led11848F20198221569196012709">three and nine</a> months ended <a data-tblloc="21x1" data-tblname="11848" data-tblv="27" id="led11848F20195281561734519658">December 31, 2019</a>, respectively, compared to 48% and 56% for the&nbsp;<a data-tblloc="27x1" data-tblname="11848" data-tblv="27" id="led11848F20198221569196012709">three and nine</a> months ended <a data-tblloc="22x1" data-tblname="11848" data-tblv="27" id="led11848F20195281561734559428">December 31, 2018</a>, respectively. Our Grid business unit revenues<font style="background-color:null;"> increased&nbsp;</font><a data-tblloc="6x1" data-tblname="27479" data-tblv="27" id="led27479F20200191579477714133">123%</a>&nbsp;and&nbsp;<a data-tblloc="6x2" data-tblname="27479" data-tblv="27" id="led27479F20200191579477751357">57%</a>&nbsp;to $<a data-tblloc="8x1" data-tblname="12412" data-tblv="27" id="led12412F20195281561734741251">15.2</a> million and $<a data-tblloc="8x2" data-tblname="12412" data-tblv="27" id="led12412F20198231569197359964">36.6</a> million in the&nbsp;<a data-tblloc="27x1" data-tblname="11848" data-tblv="27" id="led11848F20198221569196012709">three and nine</a> months ended <a data-tblloc="21x1" data-tblname="11848" data-tblv="27" id="led11848F20195281561734769851">December 31, 2019</a>, respectively, from $6.8 million and $23.3 million in the&nbsp;<a data-tblloc="27x1" data-tblname="11848" data-tblv="27" id="led11848F20198221569196012709">three and nine</a> months ended <a data-tblloc="22x1" data-tblname="11848" data-tblv="27" id="led11848F20195281561734809252">December 31, 2018</a>, respectively. Grid business unit reven<font style="background-color:null;">ue in both the three and nine months ended December 31, 2019 increased primarily driven by growth in D-VAR, SPS and REG revenue.</font></p>

<p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 36pt;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 36pt;">Our Wind business unit accounted for&nbsp;<a data-tblloc="3x1" data-tblname="12412" data-tblv="27" id="led12412F20199161571239473175">15%</a> and&nbsp;<a data-tblloc="3x2" data-tblname="12412" data-tblv="27" id="led12412F20199161571239495903">20%</a> of total revenues for the&nbsp;<a data-tblloc="27x1" data-tblname="11848" data-tblv="27" id="led11848F20198221569196012709">three and nine</a> months ended <a data-tblloc="21x1" data-tblname="11848" data-tblv="27" id="led11848F20195281561733500153">December 31, 2019</a>, respectively, compared to 52% and 44% for the&nbsp;<a data-tblloc="27x1" data-tblname="11848" data-tblv="27" id="led11848F20198221569196012709">three and nine</a> months ended <a data-tblloc="22x1" data-tblname="11848" data-tblv="27" id="led11848F20195281561733526467">December 31, 2018</a>, respectively. Revenues in the Wind business un<font style="background-color:null;">it decreased </font><a data-tblloc="5x1" data-tblname="12412" data-tblv="27" id="led12412F20195281561733769987">63%</a> and&nbsp;<a data-tblloc="5x2" data-tblname="12412" data-tblv="27" id="led12412F20198231569198166744">50%</a> to $<a data-tblloc="7x1" data-tblname="12412" data-tblv="27" id="led12412F20195281561733946735">2.7</a> million and $<a data-tblloc="7x2" data-tblname="12412" data-tblv="27" id="led12412F20198231569198199769">9.1</a> million in the&nbsp;<a data-tblloc="27x1" data-tblname="11848" data-tblv="27" id="led11848F20198221569196012709">three and nine</a> months ended <a data-tblloc="21x1" data-tblname="11848" data-tblv="27" id="led11848F20195281561733972144">December 31, 2019</a>, respectively, from $7.3 million and $18.3 million in the&nbsp;<a data-tblloc="27x1" data-tblname="11848" data-tblv="27" id="led11848F20198221569196012709">three and nine</a> months ended <a data-tblloc="22x1" data-tblname="11848" data-tblv="27" id="led11848F20195281561734011124">December 31, 2018</a>, respectively. <font style="background-color:null;">The decreases over the prior year period were driven primarily by decreased shipments of ECS to Inox offset slightly by increased development<font style="color:#ff0000;"><font style="background-color:null;"> </font></font>revenue for the 3MW wind turbine platform with Inox and the 5.5MW with Doosan.&nbsp; </font>As further described in Note 1 &#8220;Nature of the Business and Operations and Liquidity,&#8221; Inox is currently delinquent on its obligations to post letters of credit for sets of electrical control systems that Inox has agreed to purchase under the terms of the supply contract.&nbsp; We cannot predict if and when Inox will resume posting letters of credit for payment of contracted-for shipments of electrical control systems. Any continued failure by Inox to post letters of credit and take delivery of contracted-for shipments of electrical control shipments would impact the Company&#8217;s revenues and liquidity.&nbsp;<font style="background-color:null;"> Inox has been active in the new central and state government auction regime in India and has over 900 MW of orders from the first four SECI central government auctions, and 50 MW from the Maharashtra state government auction. However, we cannot predict if and how successful Inox will be in executing on these orders or in obtaining new orders under the new central and state auction regime. Any failure by Inox to succeed under this regime, or any delay in Inox&#8217;s ability to deliver its wind turbines, could result in fewer ECS shipments to Inox.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:27.75pt;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:left;"><b><i>Cost of Revenues and Gross Margin</i></b></p>

<p style="font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:left;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 36pt;">Cost of revenues<font style="background-color:null;"> increased b</font>y&nbsp;<a data-tblloc="2x1" data-tblname="27402" data-tblv="27" id="led27402F20200191579477887396">57%</a>&nbsp;and <a data-tblloc="2x2" data-tblname="27402" data-tblv="27" id="led27402F20200191579477926068">28%</a>&nbsp;to $<a data-tblloc="3x1" data-tblname="12395" data-tblv="27" id="led12395F20195281561741283657">16.3</a> million and $<a data-tblloc="3x2" data-tblname="12395" data-tblv="27" id="led12395F20198231569198799213">38.8</a> million for the&nbsp;<a data-tblloc="27x1" data-tblname="11848" data-tblv="27" id="led11848F20198221569196012709">three and nine</a> months ended <a data-tblloc="21x1" data-tblname="11848" data-tblv="27" id="led11848F20195281561741311781">December 31, 2019</a>, respectively, compared to $10.4 million and $30.4 million for the&nbsp;<a data-tblloc="27x1" data-tblname="11848" data-tblv="27" id="led11848F20198221569196012709">three and nine</a> months ended <a data-tblloc="22x1" data-tblname="11848" data-tblv="27" id="led11848F20195281561741352407">December 31, 2018</a>, respectively. Gross margin was&nbsp;<a data-tblloc="4x1" data-tblname="12395" data-tblv="27" id="led12395F20199161571239866360">9%</a> and&nbsp;<a data-tblloc="4x2" data-tblname="12395" data-tblv="27" id="led12395F20199161571239898195">15%</a> for the&nbsp;<a data-tblloc="27x1" data-tblname="11848" data-tblv="27" id="led11848F20198221569196012709">three and nine</a> months ended <a data-tblloc="21x1" data-tblname="11848" data-tblv="27" id="led11848F20195281561741407135">December 31, 2019</a>, respectively, compared to 26% and 27% for the&nbsp;<a data-tblloc="27x1" data-tblname="11848" data-tblv="27" id="led11848F20198221569196012709">three and nine</a> months ended <a data-tblloc="22x1" data-tblname="11848" data-tblv="27" id="led11848F20195281561741442786">December 31, 2018</a>, respectively.&nbsp; <font style="background-color:null;">The decrease in gross margin in the three and nine months ended&nbsp;</font><a data-tblloc="21x1" data-tblname="11848" data-tblv="27" id="led11848F20195281561741407135">December 31, 2019</a>&nbsp;<font style="background-color:null;">was primarily due to increased revenue from cost share projects with DHS and a less favorable product mix in the current year periods. &nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:27.75pt;">&nbsp;</p>

<div class="PGBK" style="width: 100%; margin-left: 0pt; margin-right: 0pt">
<div class="PGNUM" style="text-align: center; width: 100%; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt;">&nbsp;25</div>

<hr style="page-break-after: always; border: none; width: 100%; height: 2px; color: #000000; background-color: #000000">
<div class="PGHDR" style="text-align: left; width: 100%">&nbsp;</div>
</div>

<p style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: left">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:left;"><b><i>Operating Expenses</i></b></p>

<p style="font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:left;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:left;"><i>Research and development</i></p>

<p style="font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:left;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 36pt;">R&amp;D expense<font style="background-color:null;">s decreased&nbsp;</font><a data-tblloc="6x1" data-tblname="27402" data-tblv="27" id="led27402F20200191579478022463">17%</a><font style="background-color:null;">&nbsp;in the three months ended </font><a data-tblloc="21x1" data-tblname="11848" data-tblv="27" id="led11848F20195281561742401036">December 31, 2019</a><font style="background-color:null;"> to $</font><a data-tblloc="5x1" data-tblname="12395" data-tblv="27" id="led12395F20195281561742447489">2.0</a><font style="background-color:null;"> million from $2.5 million in the three months ended&nbsp;</font><a data-tblloc="22x1" data-tblname="11848" data-tblv="27" id="led11848F20195281561742485202">December 31, 2018</a>.&nbsp; <font style="background-color:null;">R&amp;D expenses decreased </font><a data-tblloc="6x2" data-tblname="27402" data-tblv="27" id="led27402F20200191579478060887">9%</a><font style="background-color:null;">&nbsp;in the </font><a data-tblloc="14x1" data-tblname="11848" data-tblv="27" id="led11848F20195271561651919010">nine</a> <font style="background-color:null;">months ended&nbsp;</font><a data-tblloc="21x1" data-tblname="11848" data-tblv="27" id="led11848F20195281561742401036">December 31, 2019</a><font style="background-color:null;"> to $<a data-tblloc="5x2" data-tblname="12395" data-tblv="27" id="led12395F20198231569199333149">6.9</a> million from $7.6 million in the </font><a data-tblloc="14x1" data-tblname="11848" data-tblv="27" id="led11848F20195271561651919010">nine</a> <font style="background-color:null;">months ended </font><a data-tblloc="22x1" data-tblname="11848" data-tblv="27" id="led11848F20195281561742485202">December 31, 2018</a><font style="background-color:null;">.&nbsp;&nbsp;The decreases in R&amp;D expense in both the three and&nbsp; </font><a data-tblloc="14x1" data-tblname="11848" data-tblv="27" id="led11848F20195271561651919010">nine</a> <font style="background-color:null;">month periods were primarily due to better labor absorption to cost of revenues to support revenue generating projects.</font></p>

<p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 36pt;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;"><i>Selling, general, and administrative</i></p>

<p style="font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 36pt;">SG&amp;A expen<font style="background-color:null;">ses increased </font><a data-tblloc="8x1" data-tblname="27402" data-tblv="27" id="led27402F20200191579478211317">14%</a><font style="background-color:null;">&nbsp;in the three months ended </font><a data-tblloc="21x1" data-tblname="11848" data-tblv="27" id="led11848F20195281561742401036">December 31, 2019</a> <font style="background-color:null;">to $</font><a data-tblloc="7x1" data-tblname="12395" data-tblv="27" id="led12395F20195281561746027460">6.1</a><font style="background-color:null;"> million&nbsp;from $5.3 million&nbsp;in the three months ended&nbsp;</font><a data-tblloc="22x1" data-tblname="11848" data-tblv="27" id="led11848F20195281561742485202">December 31, 2018</a>.<font style="background-color:null;"> </font><font style="background-color:null;">SG&amp;A expenses increased </font><a data-tblloc="8x2" data-tblname="27402" data-tblv="27" id="led27402F20200191579478252711">3%</a><font style="background-color:null;">&nbsp;in the </font><a data-tblloc="14x1" data-tblname="11848" data-tblv="27" id="led11848F20195271561651919010">nine</a> <font style="background-color:null">months ended&nbsp;</font><a data-tblloc="21x1" data-tblname="11848" data-tblv="27" id="led11848F20195281561742401036">December 31, 2019</a><font style="background-color:null;"> to $<a data-tblloc="7x2" data-tblname="12395" data-tblv="27" id="led12395F20198231569199462597">16.7</a> million from $16.3 million in the&nbsp;</font><a data-tblloc="14x1" data-tblname="11848" data-tblv="27" id="led11848F20195271561651919010">nine</a><font style="background-color:null;"> months ended </font><a data-tblloc="22x1" data-tblname="11848" data-tblv="27" id="led11848F20195281561746080297">December 31, 2018</a><font style="background-color:null;">. The increases in SG&amp;A expense in the both the three and&nbsp;</font><a data-tblloc="14x1" data-tblname="11848" data-tblv="27" id="led11848F20195271561651919010">nine</a><font style="background-color:null;"> month periods was due primarily to higher overall compensation expense than the prior fiscal year.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="margin: 0pt; text-align: justify; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,Times,serif; font-size: 10pt;"><i>Gain on Sinovel settlement</i></p>

<p style="margin: 0pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 36pt; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,Times,serif; font-size: 10pt;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="margin: 0pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 36pt; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,Times,serif; font-size: 10pt;">We recorded a gain of $25.0 million and $53.7 million, net of legal and other direct costs, in the <a data-tblloc="27x1" data-tblname="11848" data-tblv="27" id="led11848F20198221569196012709">three and nine</a> months ended <a data-tblloc="22x1" data-tblname="11848" data-tblv="27" id="led11848F20195281561746344667">December 31, 2018</a>, respectively, as a result of the receipt of the payments from Sinovel required by the Settlement Agreement.</p>

<p style="font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;"><i>Amortization of acquisition related intangibles</i></p>

<p style="font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:left;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 36pt;">We recorded amortization expense related to our core technology and know-how, trade names and trademark, and intangible assets of $<a data-tblloc="9x1" data-tblname="12395" data-tblv="27" id="led12395F20195281561746198092">0.1</a> million and $<a data-tblloc="9x2" data-tblname="12395" data-tblv="27" id="led12395F20198231569199558657">0.3</a> million in the&nbsp;<a data-tblloc="27x1" data-tblname="11848" data-tblv="27" id="led11848F20198221569196012709">three and nine</a> month periods ended <a data-tblloc="21x1" data-tblname="11848" data-tblv="27" id="led11848F20195281561746230794">December 31, 2019</a>, respectively, and $0.1 million and $0.3 million in the three and nine months ended <a data-tblloc="22x1" data-tblname="11848" data-tblv="27" id="led11848F20195281561746344667">December 31, 2018</a> respectively.</p>

<p style="font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:left;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;"><i>Restructuring</i></p>

<p style="font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 36pt;">We recorded $0.1 million and $0.4 million for facility exit costs in the&nbsp;<a data-tblloc="27x1" data-tblname="11848" data-tblv="27" id="led11848F20198221569196012709">three and nine</a> months ended&nbsp;<a data-tblloc="22x1" data-tblname="11848" data-tblv="27" id="led11848F20195281561746344667">December 31, 2018</a>, respectively, as a result of the relocation of the corporate office that was announced as part of our April 4, 2017 approved restructuring plan.&nbsp; There was no restructuring activity in the <a data-tblloc="27x1" data-tblname="11848" data-tblv="27" id="led11848F20198221569196012709">three and nine</a> months ended <a data-tblloc="21x1" data-tblname="11848" data-tblv="27" id="led11848F20195281561746059533">December 31, 2019</a>.</p>

<p style="font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:left;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:left;text-indent:27.75pt;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 36pt;">Our Grid segment generated an operating loss of $<a data-tblloc="1x1" data-tblname="12404" data-tblv="27" id="led12404F20195281561746513085">3.7</a> million and $<a data-tblloc="1x2" data-tblname="12404" data-tblv="27" id="led12404F20198231569199772255">9.7</a> million in the <a data-tblloc="27x1" data-tblname="11848" data-tblv="27" id="led11848F20198221569196012709">three and nine</a> months ended <a data-tblloc="21x1" data-tblname="11848" data-tblv="27" id="led11848F20195281561746542776">December 31, 2019</a>, respectively, compared to $2.7 million and $8.2 million in the <a data-tblloc="27x1" data-tblname="11848" data-tblv="27" id="led11848F20198221569196012709">three and nine</a> months ended <a data-tblloc="22x1" data-tblname="11848" data-tblv="27" id="led11848F20195281561746573918">December 31, 2018</a>, respectively. <font style="background-color:null;">The increase in the Grid business unit operating loss in the three</font><font style="background-color:null;"> and nine months ended <a data-tblloc="21x1" data-tblname="11848" data-tblv="27" id="led11848F20196221563821921265">December 31, 2019</a> was primarily due to</font><font style="background-color:null;"> a less favorable product mix than in the prior year period</font><font style="background-color:null;">.</font></p>

<p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 36pt;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 36pt;">Our Wind segment generated an operating loss of $<a data-tblloc="2x1" data-tblname="12404" data-tblv="27" id="led12404F20195281561746675484">2.3</a> milli<font style="background-color:null;">on and $<a data-tblloc="2x2" data-tblname="12404" data-tblv="27" id="led12404F20198231569199955861">6.0</a> million in the</font> <a data-tblloc="27x1" data-tblname="11848" data-tblv="27" id="led11848F20198221569196012709">three and nine</a><font style="background-color:null;"> months ended </font><a data-tblloc="21x1" data-tblname="11848" data-tblv="27" id="led11848F20195281561746713597">December 31, 2019</a><font style="background-color:null;">, respectively, compared to income of $24.3 million and $51.4 million in the</font> <a data-tblloc="27x1" data-tblname="11848" data-tblv="27" id="led11848F20198221569196012709">three and nine</a><font style="background-color:null;"> months ended </font><a data-tblloc="22x1" data-tblname="11848" data-tblv="27" id="led11848F20195281561746741698">December 31, 2018</a><font style="background-color:null;">, respectively. The decreases in the Wind business unit operating income in both periods were due primarily to </font>receipt of the payments from Sinovel required by the Settlement Agreement in the second and third quarters of fiscal 2018 and no such payment in fiscal 2019<font style="background-color:null;">.</font></p>

<p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 36pt;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 36pt;">Unallocated corporate expenses primarily consist of stock-based compensation expense of $<a data-tblloc="1x1" data-tblname="12407" data-tblv="27" id="led12407F20195271561652019293">0.6</a> million and $0.8 million in the three months ended&nbsp;<a data-tblloc="21x1" data-tblname="11848" data-tblv="27" id="led11848F20195271561651865040">December 31, 2019</a> and <a data-tblloc="7x1" data-tblname="11848" data-tblv="27" id="led11848F20195271561651878702">2018</a>, respectively, and restructuring charges of $0.1 million in the three months ended <a data-tblloc="22x1" data-tblname="11848" data-tblv="27" id="led11848F20195271561651935548">December 31, 2018</a>.&nbsp; Unallocated corporate expenses primarily consist of stock-based compensation expense of $<a data-tblloc="1x2" data-tblname="12407" data-tblv="27" id="led12407F20199161571241393343">1.2</a> million and $2.4 million in the&nbsp;<a data-tblloc="14x1" data-tblname="11848" data-tblv="27" id="led11848F20195271561651849635">nine</a> months ended&nbsp;<a data-tblloc="21x1" data-tblname="11848" data-tblv="27" id="led11848F20195271561651865040">December 31, 2019</a> and <a data-tblloc="7x1" data-tblname="11848" data-tblv="27" id="led11848F20195271561651878702">2018</a>, respectively, and restructuring charges of $0.4 million in the <a data-tblloc="14x1" data-tblname="11848" data-tblv="27" id="led11848F20195271561651919010">nine</a> months ended <a data-tblloc="22x1" data-tblname="11848" data-tblv="27" id="led11848F20195271561651935548">December 31, 2018</a>.</p>

<p style="font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;"><b><i>Change in fair value of warrants</i></b></p>

<p style="font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 36pt;">The change in fair value of warrants resulted in <font style="background-color:null;">gains </font>of $<a data-tblloc="10x1" data-tblname="12395" data-tblv="27" id="led12395F20195281561747127074">0.6</a> million and $<a data-tblloc="10x2" data-tblname="12395" data-tblv="27" id="led12395F20198231569200764262">4.6</a> million in the&nbsp;<a data-tblloc="27x1" data-tblname="11848" data-tblv="27" id="led11848F20198221569196012709">three and nine</a> months ended <a data-tblloc="21x1" data-tblname="11848" data-tblv="27" id="led11848F20195281561747160963">December 31, 2019</a>, respectively, compared to losses of $2.5 million and $2.7 million in the&nbsp;<a data-tblloc="27x1" data-tblname="11848" data-tblv="27" id="led11848F20198221569196012709">three and nine</a> months ended <a data-tblloc="22x1" data-tblname="11848" data-tblv="27" id="led11848F20195281561747205755">December 31, 2018</a>, respectively. The change in the fair value was primarily driven by changes in stock price, which is a key valuation metric, as well as the exercise of the Hercules warrant in June 2019 and Hudson warrants in November 2019.</p>

<p style="font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:27.75pt;">&nbsp;</p>

<div class="PGBK" style="width: 100%; margin-left: 0pt; margin-right: 0pt">
<div class="PGNUM" style="text-align: center; width: 100%; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt;">26</div>

<hr style="page-break-after: always; border: none; width: 100%; height: 2px; color: #000000; background-color: #000000">
<div class="PGHDR" style="text-align: left; width: 100%">&nbsp;</div>
</div>

<p style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: left">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="margin:0pt; text-align:justify">&nbsp;</p>

<div style="font-size:10pt">
<div style="font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif"><b><i>Minority Interest</i></b></div>

<div style="font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif">&nbsp;</div>
</div>

<p style="margin: 0pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 36pt;">The gain on sale of minority interest was $0.1 million in each of the three and nine months ended December&nbsp;31, 2018. &nbsp;There was no minority interest activity in the <a data-tblloc="27x1" data-tblname="11848" data-tblv="27" id="led11848F20198221569196012709">three and nine</a> months ended <a data-tblloc="21x1" data-tblname="11848" data-tblv="27" id="led11848F20195281561746059533">December 31, 2019</a>.</p>

<p><b><i>Interest income, net</i></b></p>

<p style="margin: 0pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 36pt; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,Times,serif; font-size: 10pt;">Interest income, net, was $<a data-tblloc="12x1" data-tblname="12395" data-tblv="27" id="led12395F20195281561747334528">0.3</a> million and $<a data-tblloc="12x2" data-tblname="12395" data-tblv="27" id="led12395F20198231569201179865">1.1</a> million in the&nbsp;<a data-tblloc="27x1" data-tblname="11848" data-tblv="27" id="led11848F20198221569196012709">three and nine</a> months ended <a data-tblloc="21x1" data-tblname="11848" data-tblv="27" id="led11848F20195281561747365664">December 31, 2019</a>, compared to $0.3 million and $0.8 million in the&nbsp;<a data-tblloc="27x1" data-tblname="11848" data-tblv="27" id="led11848F20198221569196012709">three and nine</a> months ended <a data-tblloc="22x1" data-tblname="11848" data-tblv="27" id="led11848F20195281561747400150">December 31, 2018</a>. T<font style="background-color:null;">he increase in interes</font>t income in the nine months ended&nbsp;<a data-tblloc="21x1" data-tblname="11848" data-tblv="27" id="led11848F20195281561747716287">December 31, 2019</a> was primarily related to higher cash balances earning higher interest rates than in prior periods as well as the non-cash interest income recognized from receipt of the final payment on the Devens facility note receivable.</p>

<p style="font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;"><b><i>Other (expense) income, net</i></b></p>

<p style="font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 36pt;">Other expense, net, was $<a data-tblloc="13x1" data-tblname="12395" data-tblv="27" id="led12395F20195281561747503266">0.9</a> million and other income, net was less than $<a data-tblloc="13x2" data-tblname="12395" data-tblv="27" id="led12395F20198231569201256691">0.1</a> million in the&nbsp;<a data-tblloc="27x1" data-tblname="11848" data-tblv="27" id="led11848F20198221569196012709">three and nine</a> months ended <a data-tblloc="21x1" data-tblname="11848" data-tblv="27" id="led11848F20195281561747539748">December 31, 2019</a>, compared to other income, net of $0.1 million and $1.1 million in the&nbsp;<a data-tblloc="27x1" data-tblname="11848" data-tblv="27" id="led11848F20198221569196012709">three and nine</a> months ended <a data-tblloc="22x1" data-tblname="11848" data-tblv="27" id="led11848F20195281561747574920">December 31, 2018</a>.&nbsp; Th<font style="background-color:null;">e increase in other expense, net, in the three month period was primarily driven by higher foreign losses.&nbsp; The decrease in other income, net, in the nine month period was primarily driven by foreign exchange gains and higher interest income.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;"><b><i>Income Taxes </i></b></p>

<p style="font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 36pt;"><font style="background-color:null;">Income tax expense was $</font><a data-tblloc="14x1" data-tblname="12395" data-tblv="27" id="led12395F20195281561747683356">0.1</a><font style="background-color:null;"> million and less than $<a data-tblloc="14x2" data-tblname="12395" data-tblv="27" id="led12395F20198231569201393253">0.1</a> million in the&nbsp;</font><a data-tblloc="27x1" data-tblname="11848" data-tblv="27" id="led11848F20198221569196012709">three and nine</a><font style="background-color:null;"> months ended </font><a data-tblloc="21x1" data-tblname="11848" data-tblv="27" id="led11848F20195281561747716287">December 31, 2019</a><font style="background-color:null;">, compared to $1.6 million and $4.5 million in the&nbsp;</font><a data-tblloc="27x1" data-tblname="11848" data-tblv="27" id="led11848F20198221569196012709">three and nine</a><font style="background-color:null;"> months ended </font><a data-tblloc="22x1" data-tblname="11848" data-tblv="27" id="led11848F20195281561747747276">December 31, 2018</a><font style="background-color:null;">. The decrease in income tax expense is due primarily to </font>the prior year repayment of previously reserved intercompany trade balances due to AMSC Austria from AMSC China, and a dividend paid by AMSC Austria to us in the nine months ended December 31, 2018 following the Sinovel settlement<font style="background-color:null;">. </font></p>

<p style="font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;"><i><b>Net (loss) income</b></i></p>

<p style="font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="margin: 0pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 36pt; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,Times,serif; font-size: 10pt;">Net loss was <font style="background-color:null;">$<a data-tblloc="15x1" data-tblname="12395" data-tblv="27" id="led12395F20199251571972509761">6.8</a> million and $<a data-tblloc="15x2" data-tblname="12395" data-tblv="27" id="led12395F20199251571972525891">11.2</a> million in </font>the&nbsp;<a data-tblloc="27x1" data-tblname="11848" data-tblv="27" id="led11848F20198221569196012709">three and nine</a> months ended <a data-tblloc="21x1" data-tblname="11848" data-tblv="27" id="led11848F20195281561747716287">December 31, 2019</a>, respectively, compared to net income of $17.3 million and $35.1 million in the&nbsp;<a data-tblloc="27x1" data-tblname="11848" data-tblv="27" id="led11848F20198221569196012709">three and nine</a> months ended <a data-tblloc="22x1" data-tblname="11848" data-tblv="27" id="led11848F20195281561747747276">December 31, 2018</a>, respectively.&nbsp;&nbsp;The <font style="background-color:null;">increase </font>in net loss in both periods was primarily driven by the receipt of the payments from Sinovel required by the Settlement Agreement in the second and third quarters of fiscal 2018 and no such payments in fiscal 2019.&nbsp;&nbsp;</p>

<p style="font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt 7.2pt;text-align:left;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;"><b><i>Non-GAAP Financial Measure - Non-GAAP Net Loss</i></b></p>

<p style="font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 36pt;">Generally, a non-GAAP financial measure is a numerical measure of a company&#8217;s performance, financial position or cash flow that either excludes or includes amounts that are not normally excluded or included in the most directly comparable measure calculated and presented in accordance with GAAP. The non-GAAP measures included in this Form 10-Q, however, should be considered in addition to, and not as a substitute for or superior to the comparable measures prepared in accordance with GAAP.</p>

<p style="font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:27.75pt;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 36pt;">We define non-GAAP net loss as net loss before sale of minority investments, stock-based compensation, gain on Sinovel settlement, net, amortization of acquisition-related intangibles, changes in fair value of warrants, and other non-cash or unusual charges, and the tax effect of those adjustments calculated at the relevant rate for our non-GAAP metric, indicated in the table below. We believe non-GAAP net loss assists management and investors in comparing our performance across reporting periods on a consistent basis by excluding these non-cash or non-recurring charges that we do not believe are indicative of our core operating performance. A reconciliation of GAAP to non-GAAP net loss is set forth in the table below (in thousands, except per share data):</p>

<p style="font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:center;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:27.75pt;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 36pt;">We incurred non-GAAP net losses of $<a data-tblloc="1x1" data-tblname="12403" data-tblv="27" id="led12403F20195281561747976831">6.7</a> million and $<a data-tblloc="1x2" data-tblname="12403" data-tblv="27" id="led12403F20198231569201721792">14.4</a> million or $<a data-tblloc="2x1" data-tblname="12403" data-tblv="27" id="led12403F20195281561747993568">0.32</a> and $<a data-tblloc="2x2" data-tblname="12403" data-tblv="27" id="led12403F20198231569201747763">0.69</a> per share, for the&nbsp;<a data-tblloc="27x1" data-tblname="11848" data-tblv="27" id="led11848F20198221569196012709">three and nine</a> months ended <a data-tblloc="21x1" data-tblname="11848" data-tblv="27" id="led11848F20195281561748026165">December 31, 2019</a>, respectively, compared to non-GAAP net losses of $2.3 million and $8.4 million, or $0.11 and $0.41 per share for the&nbsp;<a data-tblloc="27x1" data-tblname="11848" data-tblv="27" id="led11848F20198221569196012709">three and nine</a> months ended <a data-tblloc="22x1" data-tblname="11848" data-tblv="27" id="led11848F20195281561748083502">December 31, 2018</a> respectively. The <font style="background-color:null;">increases in </font>non-GAAP net loss were <font style="background-color:null;">primarily due to the more favorable product mix in the prior year period.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:27.75pt;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 36pt;">For a description and reconciliation of our other non-GAAP financial measure, non-GAAP operating cash flow, see the below under &#8220;Non-GAAP Financial Measure &#8211; Non-GAAP Operating Cash Flow.&#8221;</p>

<p style="font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:27pt;">&nbsp;</p>

<div class="PGBK" style="width: 100%; margin-left: 0pt; margin-right: 0pt">
<div class="PGNUM" style="text-align: center; width: 100%; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt;">27</div>

<hr style="page-break-after: always; border: none; width: 100%; height: 2px; color: #000000; background-color: #000000">
<div class="PGHDR" style="text-align: left; width: 100%">&nbsp;</div>
</div>

<p style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: left">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;"><b><i>Liquidity and Capital Resources</i></b></p>

<p style="font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 36pt;">We have experienced recurring operating losses, and as of&nbsp;<a data-tblloc="21x1" data-tblname="11848" data-tblv="27" id="led11848F20195281561748202178">December 31, 2019</a>, had an accumulated deficit of $<a data-tblloc="1x1" data-tblname="12414" data-tblv="27" id="led12414F20195281561748222197">972.7</a> millio<font style="background-color:null;">n. </font></p>

<p style="font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:27pt;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 36pt;">Our cash requirements depend on numerous factors, including whether Inox is successful in executing on SECI orders or in obtaining additional orders under the new central and state auction regime, whether and to the extent that Inox fulfills its purchase obligations under our supply contract, the successful completion of our product development activities, our ability to commercialize our REG and ship protection system solutions, the rate of customer and market adoption of our products, collecting receivables according to established terms, and the continued availability of U.S. government funding during the product development phase of our superconductor-based products. We continue to closely monitor our expenses and, if required, expect to further reduce our operating and capital spending to enhance liquidity.</p>

<p style="font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:27.75pt;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 36pt;">As of <a data-tblloc="21x1" data-tblname="11848" data-tblv="27" id="led11848F20195281561748617582">December 31, 2019</a>, we had cash, cash equivalents,&nbsp;restricted cash, and marketable securities&nbsp;of $<a data-tblloc="3x1" data-tblname="12411" data-tblv="27" id="led12411F20199251572019664075">66.3</a> million, compared to $78.2 million as of <a data-tblloc="23x1" data-tblname="11848" data-tblv="27" id="led11848F20195281561748737004">March 31, 2019</a>, a decrease of $<a data-tblloc="2x1" data-tblname="12411" data-tblv="27" id="led12411F20199251572019697979">11.9</a> million. As of <a data-tblloc="21x1" data-tblname="11848" data-tblv="27" id="led11848F20195281561748826889">December 31, 2019</a>, we had approximately $<a data-tblloc="1x2" data-tblname="12406" data-tblv="27" id="led12406F20195281561748846307">8.4</a> million of cash, cash equivalents, and restricted cash in foreign bank accounts. Our cash and cash equivalents, marketable securities and restricted cash are summarized as follows (in thousands):</p>

<p style="font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:27.75pt;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:left;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 36pt;">For the <a data-tblloc="14x1" data-tblname="11848" data-tblv="27" id="led11848F20195281561748008869">nine</a> months ended <a data-tblloc="21x1" data-tblname="11848" data-tblv="27" id="led11848F20195281561748617582">December 31, 2019</a>, net cash used in operating activities was $<a data-tblloc="2x2" data-tblname="12406" data-tblv="27" id="led12406F20195281561749196535">17.8</a> million compared to net cash provided by operating activities of $47.8 million for the <a data-tblloc="14x1" data-tblname="11848" data-tblv="27" id="led11848F20195281561748008869">nine</a> months ended <a data-tblloc="22x1" data-tblname="11848" data-tblv="27" id="led11848F20195281561748083502">December 31, 2018</a>. T<font style="background-color:null;">he decrease in net cash provided by operations was due primarily to the </font>receipt of the first and second payments from the Sinovel settlement in the nine months ended December 31, 2018 with no similar transaction in the nine months ended December 31, 2019<font style="background-color:null;">.</font></p>

<p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 36pt;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 36pt;"><font style="background-color:null;">For the </font><a data-tblloc="14x1" data-tblname="11848" data-tblv="27" id="led11848F20195281561748008869">nine</a><font style="background-color:null;"> months ended </font><a data-tblloc="21x1" data-tblname="11848" data-tblv="27" id="led11848F20195281561748617582">December 31, 2019</a><font style="background-color:null;">, net cash used in investing activities was $</font><a data-tblloc="3x2" data-tblname="12406" data-tblv="27" id="led12406F20195281561749249330">34.9</a><font style="background-color:null;"> million, compared to $0.7 million for the </font><a data-tblloc="14x1" data-tblname="11848" data-tblv="27" id="led11848F20195281561748008869">nine</a><font style="background-color:null;"> months ended </font><a data-tblloc="22x1" data-tblname="11848" data-tblv="27" id="led11848F20195281561748083502">December 31, 2018</a><font style="background-color:null;">. The increase in net cash used in investing activities was due primarily to the purchase of marketable securities and increased purchases of property, plant and equipment&nbsp;related to improvements to the Ayer facility and factory equipment to support the Navy and REG projects, partially offset by</font>&nbsp;the receipt of the second installment payment under the Note Receivable from the Devens facility sale<font style="background-color:null;">&nbsp;in the nine months ended December 31, 2019.&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt 7.2pt;text-align:left;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 36pt;">For the <a data-tblloc="14x1" data-tblname="11848" data-tblv="27" id="led11848F20195281561748008869">nine</a> months ended <a data-tblloc="21x1" data-tblname="11848" data-tblv="27" id="led11848F20195281561748617582">December 31, 2019</a>, net cash provided by financing activities was $<a data-tblloc="4x2" data-tblname="12406" data-tblv="27" id="led12406F20195281561749306105">5.7</a> million compared to net cash used in financing activities of $0.4 million in the <a data-tblloc="14x1" data-tblname="11848" data-tblv="27" id="led11848F20195281561748008869">nine</a> months ended <a data-tblloc="22x1" data-tblname="11848" data-tblv="27" id="led11848F20195281561748083502">December 31, 2018</a>.&nbsp; The <font style="background-color:null;">increase </font>in net cash provided by financing activities was due primaril<font style="background-color:null;">y to proceeds received from the exercise of the Hudson warrants during the nine months ended </font><a data-tblloc="21x1" data-tblname="11848" data-tblv="27" id="led11848F20195281561748617582">December 31, 2019</a><font style="background-color:null;">.</font></p>

<p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 36pt;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 36pt;">As of <a data-tblloc="21x1" data-tblname="11848" data-tblv="27" id="led11848F20195281561749361558">December 31, 2019</a>, we had $<a data-tblloc="1x1" data-tblname="12411" data-tblv="27" id="led12411F20195281561749385499">5.8</a> million of restricted cash included in long-term assets. These amounts included in restricted cash primarily represent deposits to secure letters of credit for various supply contracts and long-term projects. These deposits are held in interest bearing accounts.</p>

<p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 36pt;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 36pt;">We believe we have sufficient available liquidity to fund our operations and capital expenditures for the next twelve months. In addition, we may seek to raise additional capital, which could be in the form of loans, convertible debt or equity, to fund our operating requirements and capital expenditures. Our liquidity is highly dependent on our ability to increase revenues, including our ability to collect revenues under our agreements with Inox, control our operating costs, and our ability to raise additional capital, if necessary. There can be no assurance that we will be able to raise additional capital, on favorable terms or at all, or execute on any other means of improving our liquidity as described above.</p>

<p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 36pt;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="margin: 0pt; text-align: justify; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,Times,serif; font-size: 10pt;"><i><b>Non-GAAP Financial Measure &#8211; Non-GAAP Operating Cash Flow</b></i></p>

<p style="margin: 0pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 36pt; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,Times,serif; font-size: 10pt;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="margin: 0pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 36pt; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,Times,serif; font-size: 10pt;">We define non-GAAP operating cash flow as operating cash flow before the Sinovel settlement (net of legal fees and expenses); tax effect of adjustments; and other unusual cash flows or items. We believe non-GAAP operating cash flow assists management and investors in comparing our operating cash flow across reporting periods on a consistent basis by excluding these non-recurring cash items that it does not believe are indicative of our core operating cash flow. A reconciliation of GAAP to non-GAAP operating cash flow is set forth in the table below (in thousands).</p>

<p style="margin: 0pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 36pt; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,Times,serif; font-size: 10pt;">&nbsp;</p>

<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="finTable" data-tbledgar="true" data-tblname="11865" data-tblv="27" style="width: 100%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; text-indent: 0px;">

		<tr style="background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); vertical-align: bottom">
			<td style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; padding: 0; margin: 0">&nbsp;</td>
			<td id=".lead.2" style="width: 1%; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; padding: 0; margin: 0">&nbsp;</td>
			<td id=".symb.2" style="width: 1%; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; padding: 0; margin: 0">&nbsp;</td>
			<td colspan="5" id=".amt.2" rowspan="1" style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px; width: 12%; text-align: center; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,Times,serif; font-size: 10pt;"><b>Nine months ended</b></td>
			<td id=".trail.3" nowrap="true" style="width: 1%; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; padding: 0; margin: 0">&nbsp;</td>
		</tr>
		<tr style="background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); vertical-align: bottom">
			<td style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt;">&nbsp;</td>
			<td id=".lead.D2" style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt;">&nbsp;</td>
			<td colspan="2" id=".amt.D2" style="text-align: center; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin-left: 0pt; border-bottom: 1px solid rgb(0, 0, 0);">
			<p style="font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:center;"><b>December 31, 2019</b></p>
			</td>
			<td id=".trail.D2" style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; padding-bottom: 1px;">&nbsp;</td>

			<p style="font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:center;"><b>December 31, 2018</b></p>
			</td>
			<td id=".trail.D3" style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; padding-bottom: 1px;">&nbsp;</td>
		</tr>
		<tr style="background-color: rgb(204, 238, 255); vertical-align: bottom">
			<td style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; width: 70%;">
			<p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;">Operating cash flow</p>
			</td>
			<td id=".lead.2" style="width: 1%; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt;">&nbsp;</td>

			<td id=".amt.2" style="width: 12%; text-align: right; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin-left: 0pt;">(17,779</td>
			<td id=".trail.2" nowrap="true" style="width: 1%; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin-left: 0pt;">)</td>
			<td id=".lead.3" style="width: 1%; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt;">&nbsp;</td>

			<td id=".amt.3" style="width: 12%; text-align: right; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin-left: 0pt;">47,786</td>

		</tr>
		<tr style="background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); vertical-align: bottom">
			<td style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt;">
			<p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;">Sinovel settlement (net of legal fees and expenses)</p>
			</td>
			<td id=".lead.2" style="width: 1%; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt;">&nbsp;</td>

		</tr>

			<td style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt;">

			<td id=".trail.3" nowrap="true" style="width: 1%; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; padding-bottom: 1px; margin-left: 0pt;">&nbsp;</td>
		</tr>
		<tr style="background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); vertical-align: bottom">
			<td style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt;">

			<td id=".amt.2" style="width: 12%; text-align: right; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin-left: 0pt; border-bottom: 3px double rgb(0, 0, 0);">(14,055</td>
			<td id=".trail.2" nowrap="true" style="width: 1%; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin-left: 0pt; padding-bottom: 3px;">)</td>
